instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165, shut down suddenly.
threads.message:
I have bought this board alone. It looks very clean. No water damage.
when it boot the os, it shuts down suddenly and don't boot again. 
I tried aslo external os it takes too long to boot.

threads.title: 820-00165, shut down suddenly.
threads.message: Try to clean ME region in BIOS.

threads.title: 820-00165, shut down suddenly.
threads.message: I don't the tool to do this, but I swapped the bios from other board...

threads.title: 820-00165, shut down suddenly.
threads.message:
BIOS taken from other  board has "dirty" ME region for your own.
Search the forum, some links for clean ME BIOSes should be already posted.

Also upload somewhere original BIOS of your board, to clean it...

threads.title: 820-00165, shut down suddenly.
threads.message: i cleaned the bios but it boot and i can log in, but in seconds it shut down

threads.title: 820-00165, shut down suddenly.
threads.message:
Did you properly clean ME region?

When boot from USB device (known good working OSX), still shuts down?

threads.title: 820-00165, shut down suddenly.
threads.message: yes, on my USB test drive it load and I can enter the os. but it suddenly shutdown.

threads.title: 820-00165, shut down suddenly.
threads.message: i tried it with your BIOS also it shutdown while loading

threads.title: 820-00165, shut down suddenly.
threads.message:
Remove U8130 and try again.
It happens to me recently.

Can be other problem, but is worth to try it.

threads.title: 820-00165, shut down suddenly.
threads.message: Test disconnecting battery and also in SMC bypass mode...

threads.title: 820-00165, shut down suddenly.
threads.message:
Still takes long time to boot through USB?
Disconnect airpoort when test.
Also try known good trackpad voard/flex.
Test without LIO flex too.

Does it boot Windows or Linux?
